summary: This document is an email chain from August 6, 2019, between a Supervisory Staff Attorney at the Correctional Center and Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys. It concerns complaints from Epstein about conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), specifically a lack of toilet paper, an unplugged CPAP machine, and limited phone access. The document highlights administrative concerns regarding Epstein's detention shortly before his death.

events.title: Epstein's Complaints About MCC Conditions
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein, via his attorneys, complains about conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including having no toilet paper, an unplugged CPAP machine, and having made only two monitored phone calls since his arrival.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: On August 6, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein complained about detention conditions at the MCC, including a lack of toilet paper in his cell.
Epstein reported his CPAP machine was not plugged in on the night of August 5-6, 2019, preventing its use.
Since his arrival at the MCC, Epstein had only been able to make two fifteen-minute phone calls, both on speaker with officers present and on unmonitored lines.
The correspondence shows administrative attention to Epstein's welfare and phone account setup just weeks before his death in custody.
